items.title: Taking Stock: Market ends flat amid volatility; autos zoom on price cut
items.description: More than 160 stocks touched their 52-week highs on the BSE, including KIOCL, Gujrat Mineral, Ashok Leyland, Tata Steel, Muthoot Finance, M&M, JSW Steel, TVS Motor, UNO Minda, L&T Finance, Dalmia Bharat, Cummins India, Nykaa, among others.

items.title: Closing Bell: Profit-booking erodes gains; Sensex off 400 pts from day's high, Nifty under 24,800
items.description: Closing Bell: Profit-booking erodes gains; Sensex off 400 pts from day's high, Nifty under 24,800. Catch Lovisha Darad and Yatin Mota as they discuss the stocks on their radar.

items.title: Broader markets up for 2nd day: Mid, smallcap stocks rise up to 7%; here are the top gainers
items.description: The Nifty Midcap 100 index jumped nearly 1% to 57,615 in the afternoon. The index has now recorded gains in five out of the six sessions in September so far.

items.title: Bharat Forge shares surge 6.18%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
items.description: Moneycontrol analysis indicates a bullish sentiment for these stocks as of September 8, 2025.

items.title: Buy CEAT; target of Rs 4600: Emkay Global Financial
items.description: Emkay Global Financial is bullish on CEAT has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 4600 in its research report dated September 07, 2025.

items.title: Tata Motors, JSW Steel, M&M among top gainers on Nifty 50
items.description: Tata Motors was trading at Rs 715.60, a gain of 3.46%, JSW Steel was at Rs 1,107.60 with a rise of 3.21%, M&M was trading at Rs 3,672.20, up 3.11%, Hero Motocorp saw its shares trading at Rs 5,507.00, a 2.69% increase, while Bajaj Auto was at Rs 9,321.50, up 2.61% among top gainers on Nifty 50.

items.description: At 2:10 pm, Infosys shares were trading among the top losers on Nifty 50, with the stock priced at Rs 1,435.40.

items.title: HAL, Cochin Shipyard, other defence stocks rise on govt's 15-year defence roadmap
items.description: Nifty India Defence index rose more than half a percent to hover around 7,559 in the afternoon trade on September 8. The index has snapped a two-day losing streak.
